meanings.definition: To enroll or enlist members in a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The teacher empanels students for the school choir.
meanings.sent2: The club empanels new members every month.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper empanels the animals for the annual parade.
meanings.sent4: The gardener empanels the flowers in a colorful display.
meanings.sent5: The captain empanels the crew before setting sail.

meanings.definition: To select or summon individuals for jury duty.
meanings.sent1: The court empanels citizens for jury duty.
meanings.sent2: The judge empanels a new jury for the trial.
meanings.sent3: The magician empanels rabbits for a jury of their peers.
meanings.sent4: The chef empanels ingredients for a flavorful dish.
meanings.sent5: The conductor empanels musicians for the orchestra performance.
